headline.main: AXIS TWICE MISSED CAPTURING CYPRUS; First in 1941, Then a Year Later, Island Outpost Would Have Been Easy Picking

lead_paragraph: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 1 -- When the Cretan chapter was closed, work on the Cyprus defenses was progressing at fever pitch. Peasant men and women were employed by the thousand to aid the military in the vast projects that resulted in an intricate system of underground communications.
abstract: Cyprus: possible use as invasion springboard cited; Axis '41 and '42 threat discussed
